comments.body: this is not really necessary if you allow ``CategoricalDtype(dtype)`` IOW, you can check whether the incoming ``categories`` is an instance of a ``CagetegoricalDtype`` and act accordingly.
I'm not sure I like overloading the `categories` like that.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1708,1712 @@        categories = getattr(dtype, 'categories', None)
        ordered = getattr(dtype, 'ordered', False)
        dtype = CategoricalDtype(categories=categories, ordered=ordered)
    elif is_datetime64tz_dtype(dtype):
        dtype = DatetimeTZDtype(dtype)

comments.body:
this is fine
but need tests that hit this

Changed this because switching to `pandas_dtype` caused a test to break since it was passing `'interval'` as the dtype, which appears to be valid:
```python
In [1]: from pandas.core.dtypes.common import is_interval_dtype

In [2]: is_interval_dtype('interval')
Out[2]: True
```
